result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Levell Beamon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
consecutive to any sentence STRAIGHT TIME.
Pursuant to SI Stats 973.176 Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions; firearms possession and voting.  Court strongly objects to electronic monitoring.  Court STAYS report date to 10/10/2014 at 1;30 P.M.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Levell Beamon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy Levell Beamon in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Brandon A. Wigley for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT  1- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Court ordered defendant to serve 20 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; straight time; credit for 5 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
Defendant to provide a DNA sample, if not already done. 
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to be paid by 4-1-2015; cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance is to be paid by 4-1-2015; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Defense requests adjourned report date. For the reasons placed on the record the Court stays the report date to 10-10-2014 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit; and
Sentencing Referral Form.

Defendant Timothy Levell Beamon in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing on 10-06-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Reduction of Bail, received and filed.

Defendant Timothy Levell Beamon in court with attorney Thomas E. Harris.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense recently retained and discovery and offer has not yet been received from the State. Defense requests adjournment for Scheduling Conference. Court orders case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Br. 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy Levell Beamon in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp    Attorney Kastenson
informs court that there was an admission by one of defendant's witnesses.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel.  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the safety building.  Status conference scheduled for 08-05-2014 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Defendant Timothy Levell Beamon in court with attorney Daryl A. Kastenson.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State's Motion for Admission of Other Acts proceeded.  Arguments made by state and defense.  Based on all written filings and testimony given in court, court ruled that Other Acts may NOT be admitted for the purpose of jury trial.  State may revist this issue during trial.  Final pretrial previously held.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 7-23-14, 9:00 a.m.

Defendant Timothy Levell Beamon in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Chojnacki).  Final pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 7-23-14, 9:00 a.m.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by the State:  Amended Witness List.  alp
Filed by the State:  Witness List, Motion for Other Acts Evidence, Requested Jury Instructions, Motion in Limine.

Defendant Timothy Levell Beamon in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Chojnacki).  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Timothy Levell Beamon in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Timothy Levell Beamon in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mary Schmitz-MPD Detective. Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #10CF2951 that are attached to the complaint. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
14RM023171  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 04-28-2014

Any remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter. 
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed, no drug paraphernalia. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Timothy Levell Beamon in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/29/14 @ 1:30pm
